channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: Why has there been no opera about Moshe Dayan? He deserves so much more than the occasional Hayehudim Baim sketch. https://t.co/czWhWmohHO
@johnastoehr “But his spirit lives on and on.”

@DavidRSelis Oh they do, they very much do.
@DavidRSelis https://t.co/X4o9ZJGDMe

@froomkin “I can't speak to the specifics of, you know, whether they have aircraft flying over it and what they're doing.” — if it’s a mixture of satellite coverage, long range radar, reliable Ukrainian reports, and penetration of Russian coms, it might be better not to show all the cards.
@trekonomics Reminds me that I should check whether my Beloved Conservative Relative’s reactionary FB friend is still posting now that Moscow is reportedly off the grid.
@Watchingwheels7 Hard to fight for a candidate whose message is, “nothing here worth fighting for.”

But he won’t, because he’s convinced himself that he can sit out the culture wars in hopes of gaining the mythical moderate voter. https://t.co/BsiMKLGO26
It’s proving to be a successful way to drive his voters to despair, because it functionally denies the obvious fact that the Republican Party and their rogue courts have gone completely radical.
Moderation in the face of extremism, to paraphrase a famously election losing candidate, is no virtue.

@456meepmoop @jayrosen_nyu @TheAtlantic There a limit to how anti-Republican the Atlantic can allow itself to be, lest it become “partisan.” Which is bad for business.
@456meepmoop @jayrosen_nyu @TheAtlantic I still remember the frightening story they ran by William Calvin 30+ years ago on the frightening possibility that global warming might shut down the Gulf Stream. Have they run anything noteworthy on climate change since climate denial became a central Republican policy?
@trekonomics I suspect that Putin — and his generation of Soviets — were strongly miseducated as to how the Bolsheviks were able to rule Ukraine with little pushback in the 20th century.

@JosieBrendaA @JewWhoHasItAll @JewishConnectiv The latter being an undercelebrated holiday that deserves to be commercialized. I notice that this year it falls on Flag Day, which one assumes is Xian Simchas Torah. Great crossover potential there.

@trekonomics Makes sense. It’s a deeply personal dissent from cultural norms. “Free to be you and me” is not a message authoritarians like.
@trekonomics Luckily, Christian authoritarians haven’t defended taking Jewish children from their homes in the name of their cultural norms since, um, 2018. https://t.co/yLG64bRQHn

@Lexaphus I’m just curious as to what was the breaking point for someone in the year of their Lord 2020. Speaking as someone who has been criticizing the institution from within and without since at least 1984.
@Lexaphus Can you tell me what the “now” is at which YU lost its way?
@onthemainline And they drive hospital revenue while saving social security money.
@JewWhoHasItAll @JewishConnectiv @JosieBrendaA Too soon!
"Rebecca Naomi Greenblatt is a Jewish main character in an urban fantasy, a rarity in and of itself, and she deals with fae creatures, demons, a mobster, and an evil warlock." https://t.co/fzwDpAkPOM
@Jacob_Labendz @bernstein_judah But well paid.
@alon_levy @GutnerIlya @Ww3Real Hence the “or so.”
@GutnerIlya @alon_levy @Ww3Real I was asking about the fictional @Ww3Real timeline, where in the fall of 2032 or so the Chinese disabled American nukes and conquered the US.
@alon_levy @Ww3Real What’s the total death toll at this point?
Something to look forward to. Promises 60% of archives to be digitized in five years. https://t.co/mTo8fkwbko
@bogiperson @RB_Lemberg @bryngreenwood מזל טוב!
@AvBronstein God is the concept by which we measure Ukraine, to paraphrase a wiser person.
Really, it’s amazing anyone bothers to make an honest living when there are so many NFT suckers willing to play in the police-free Web3 zone. https://t.co/Sxr98hFARX
